name: Pani PoPo
author: Mae
summary: Old family recipe that my family made for me when I was a little girl back in Samoa.
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) package frozen dinner rolls dough, thawed
directions: Arrange rolls in a 9x13-inch baking dish, cover the dish with plastic wrap, and let rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes
Combine 14 ounces water, coconut milk, and sugar in a saucepan
Whisk remaining water and cornstarch together in a small bowl
Bring coconut milk mixture to a boil, whisk in cornstarch mixture, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens, about 3 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake rolls in the preheated oven for 10 minutes
Pour coconut sauce over rolls until at least half of each roll is covered in sauce
Return rolls to oven; continue baking until rolls are golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes more
Cool in the baking dish, 3 to 5 minutes, before serving warm
